cont.entity_a: Heats ingredients to the correct temperature.
cont.entity_b: Burns the bottom and leaves the inside undercooked.

cont.entity_a: Adds yeast from the yeast holder. Produces well-risen and thoroughly baked bread when functioning. Moves during kneading, which can lead to damage if not monitored. Loud knocking sound during the dough cycle. Easy operation with a timer feature for overnight baking. Larger capacity and includes a yeast dispenser. Requires careful ingredient measurement for optimal results. Produces good quality bread with a variety of settings. Lack of a cancel or clear button for errors.
cont.entity_b: Convection feature can cause over-browning. Requires manual intervention for optimal mixing. Produces great bread when functioning properly. Easy to operate with a wide variety of settings. Consistently produces good gluten-free bread. Produces consistently good bread with a convection oven. Dough cycle is reliable for preparing dough.

cont.entity_a: Breaks down easily, with some units failing within a year. Durable, with some units lasting over a decade. Issues with kneading blade durability.
cont.entity_b: Some units have defects and poor customer service. Issues with paddle and pan durability over time.

cont.entity_a: Poor customer service, with high costs for support.
cont.entity_b: Some units have defects and poor customer service.

cont.entity_a: User instructions are crucial for proper operation.
cont.entity_b: Recipe book is helpful with times and instructions.
Attractive design with a brushed stainless steel finish.
